#6840 makes use of @David WÃ¤rn's early work on quivers (proving Nielsen-Schreier, yay!). However #7150 proposes changing quiver to a class.

Assuming we do want to go with #7150, the content in #6840 is going to require some adaptation. I would like to get #6840 merged asap, as it's all done and looks great.

Could some subset of @Bhavik Mehta, @Adam Topaz, @Markus Himmel, @Johan Commelin have a look at #7150 (and perhaps its followup PRs #7151 and #7158), and give an opinion on what to do?

My preference would be to merge #7150 first, give whatever help David wants updating #6840, then get #6840 merged. But I don't want to hold up #6840 needlessly.

I left a minor comment on #7150 (again a minor quibble about names).

One other comment about the three PRs that @Scott Morrison mentioned, but not necessarily relevant to #7150 in particular. Do you think that when we change has_hom to quiver that the definition of quiver should move to a different folder other than combinatorics? Maybe data/quiver.lean or something?
Yes. I'd say they're for representation theory, anyway, so we need a neutral home. :-) data should be fine.
I guess it makes sense to make this change as part of #7151 ?
